etymologies: mid 19th century. From German Siderismus (J. W. KieserDer Siderismus; from ancient Greek σίδηρος iron + -ismus), with alteration of the ending after -ism

definitions: A hidden force or influence to which have been attributed the motions of divining pendulums and other phenomena of animal magnetism.

notes.text: The concept was developed by J. W. Ritter in Germany, in 1808.
